com.blahti.example.drag2

Class DragController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blahti.example.drag2.DragController

  • public class DragController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to initiate a drag within a view or across multiple views. When a drag starts it creates a special view (a DragView) that moves around the screen until the user ends the drag. As feedback to the user, this object causes the device to vibrate as the drag begins.

    • Field Summary

      Fields

    • Method Detail

      • getMoveNo

        public static int getMoveNo()

      • setMoveNo

        public static void setMoveNo(int moveNo)

      • startDrag

        public void startDrag(View v,
             DragSource source,
             java.lang.Object dragInfo,
             int dragAction)
        Starts a drag. It creates a bitmap of the view being dragged. That bitmap is what you see moving. The actual view can be repositioned if that is what the onDrop handle chooses to do.
        Parameters:
        v - The view that is being dragged
        source - An object representing where the drag originated
        dragInfo - The data associated with the object that is being dragged
        dragAction - The drag action: either DRAG_ACTION_MOVE or DRAG_ACTION_COPY

      • startDrag

        public void startDrag(Bitmap b,
             int screenX,
             int screenY,
             int textureLeft,
             int textureTop,
             int textureWidth,
             int textureHeight,
             DragSource source,
             java.lang.Object dragInfo,
             int dragAction)
        Starts a drag.
        Parameters:
        b - The bitmap to display as the drag image. It will be re-scaled to the enlarged size.
        screenX - The x position on screen of the left-top of the bitmap.
        screenY - The y position on screen of the left-top of the bitmap.
        textureLeft - The left edge of the region inside b to use.
        textureTop - The top edge of the region inside b to use.
        textureWidth - The width of the region inside b to use.
        textureHeight - The height of the region inside b to use.
        source - An object representing where the drag originated
        dragInfo - The data associated with the object that is being dragged
        dragAction - The drag action: either DRAG_ACTION_MOVE or DRAG_ACTION_COPY
